toileflush.name: Toilet Flush (1 time)
toileflush.tip: Use dual-flush toilets to save ~50% water.
toileflush.reason: Conventional toilets use 6â€“12 liters per flush depending on design.
toileflush.suggestion: Skip one toilet flush by using greywater or collect AC water to clean floors.

dishwash.name: Hand Dishwashing (10 mins)
dishwash.tip: Fill the sink instead of letting water run.
dishwash.reason: Running tap uses ~10 liters per minute. Filling a basin reduces wastage.
dishwash.suggestion: Water your plants using leftover rinse water to balance household use.

brushing.name: Brushing Teeth (2 mins, tap running)
brushing.tip: Turn off tap while brushing to save up to 10 L.
brushing.reason: A running tap wastes ~6 liters per minute.
brushing.suggestion: Turn off the tap while brushing for a week to save equivalent water.

laundry.name: Washing Machine (1 load)
laundry.tip: Run full loads and use efficient machines.
laundry.reason: Standard machines use 50â€“100 L per wash depending on model and cycle.
laundry.suggestion: Reuse washing machine greywater for floor cleaning or gardening.

garden.name: Garden Watering (30 mins hose)
garden.tip: Water early morning or evening to reduce evaporation.
garden.reason: Garden hoses use ~15 liters per minute, which adds up quickly during watering.
garden.suggestion: Install a rain barrel system to collect and reuse rainwater for plants.

coffee.name: Coffee (1 cup)

coffee.reason: Coffee beans require a lot of irrigation during farming and large amounts of water for processing after harvest.
coffee.suggestion: Plant one tree every month to offset coffee-related water footprint.

rice.name: Rice (1 kg)
rice.tip: Switch to millet or quinoa occasionally to save water.
rice.reason: Rice is usually grown in flooded fields, which consume huge volumes of water compared to other grains.
rice.suggestion: Replace one rice meal per week with millet or wheat-based food.

Red Meat.name: Red Meat (1 kg)
Red Meat.tip: Replacing beef with chicken saves ~80% water.
equivalents: ğŸ” 1 red meat burger = water for 2 months of daily showers
Red Meat.reason: Cattle need large amounts of drinking water and feed, and growing animal feed (corn, soy) requires massive irrigation.
Red Meat.suggestion: Skip one red meat meal per week to reduce annual water use by thousands of liters.

tshirt.name: Cotton T-Shirt
tshirt.tip: Buy fewer clothes & prefer organic cotton.
tshirt.reason: Cotton crops are highly water-intensive, and additional water is used in textile dyeing and finishing processes.
tshirt.suggestion: Reuse or donate clothes instead of buying new ones frequently.

milk.name: Milk (1 liter)
milk.tip: Try plant-based alternatives like oat or soy milk.
equivalents: ğŸ¥› 1 glass of milk = water for 30 minutes of showering
milk.reason: Cows need a lot of drinking water and feed, and producing feed crops like corn/soy requires heavy irrigation.
milk.suggestion: Replace dairy with plant-based milk 2â€“3 times a week.

egg.name: Egg (1 piece)
egg.tip: Reducing egg consumption helps lower footprint.
egg.reason: Hens consume grain-based feed grown with irrigation, plus water is used for poultry care and egg processing.
egg.suggestion: Use plant-based egg substitutes once a week to reduce water use.

potato.name: Potato (1 kg)
potato.tip: Opt for locally grown potatoes to save transport water footprint.
potato.reason: Potatoes are relatively water-efficient, but irrigation is still required during farming.
potato.suggestion: Compost food scraps to return nutrients and moisture to the soil.

shower.name: Shower (7 minutes)
shower.tip: Take 5-minute showers instead of 10 to cut water use by half.
shower.reason: A standard shower uses 9â€“10 liters of water per minute. Shortening shower time saves large amounts of water daily.
shower.suggestion: Install a low-flow showerhead to cut water use by 40%.

bikewash.name: Bike Wash (1 time)
bikewash.tip: Use a bucket instead of a running hose to save up to 40 L.

bikewash.reason: Using a running hose wastes water quickly, while bucket washing reduces consumption significantly.
bikewash.suggestion: Wash bikes using collected rainwater or leftover rinse water.
